page.title: 08OPEN-CAST MINING AT AMBLE
page.content: The{three main open-cast sites}in the Amble area are at{East Chevington, {Acklington, and Togston.}About{279 people are{employed by the N.C.B.}who own the sites.{Open-cast mining}is a {cheaper and easier way to extract coal than{deep mining which it has replaced in the area. The{method of open-cast mining is as follows:-{firstly the top {soil and subsoil are ripped off}and {put into mounds or baffle-banks.}These prevent noise, vibration, and dust. Using{a drag-line}which costs about Â£6.5 million they can{descend 90m.}to {coal seams which are about 0.4-1.5 m. {thick.}The coal that is mined is used for{power stations, households, or {mixed with deep mined coal.}It takes from{1.5-2 years to restore a site.}At {Chevington}they are doing{progressive {restoration i.e. they are restoring in parts and mining other areas.
